html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • dēcalceō

Etymology[edit]

dē- (“removing”) +‎ calx, calceus (“heel”, “shoe”) +‎ -ō (suffix forming first-conjugation verbs)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /deːˈkal.ki.oː/, [d̪eːˈkaɫ̪.ki.oː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /deˈkal.t͡ʃi.o/, [d̪ɛˈkal̠ʲ.t͡ʃi.ɔ]

Verb[edit]

dēcalciō (present infinitive dēcalciāre, perfect active dēcalciāvī, supine dēcalciātum); first conjugation

  1. (New Latin) I take off or remove shoes

Conjugation[edit]
